noble_weary.speaker: Narrator
noble_weary.text: The Masked Noble sits alone, their posture less rigid than usual. The mask seems heavier on their face today.

noble_opens_up.speaker: The Masked Noble
noble_opens_up.text: I was seven when they placed the first crown on my head for a portrait. It was too heavy for my neck. I cried. They told me a ruler never shows weakness.

noble_childhood.speaker: The Masked Noble
noble_childhood.text: Every day since, I've worn invisible crowns. The weight never lessened. I learned to hide my tears, my fears, my very self behind masks more ornate than this one.

noble_breaking.speaker: The Masked Noble
noble_breaking.text: *Their voice cracks* When I left, I told myself it was temporary. A respite. But the longer I'm here, the more I realize... I don't want to go back to being a portrait.

choices.text: Who you are beneath the mask is more real than any crown.
A ruler who understands common life could change things for the better.

noble_moved.speaker: The Masked Noble
noble_moved.text: *Tears glisten beneath the mask* No one has ever... all my life, I was told the role defines the person. You're telling me the person can define the role?

noble_considers.speaker: The Masked Noble
noble_considers.text: *They pause, struck by the thought* Change things... I never considered that I could wear the crown differently. That the power could be used to give others what I craved.

noble_realization.speaker: The Masked Noble
noble_realization.text: All this time, I thought my only choices were submission or escape. But perhaps... perhaps there's a third path. One where the mask becomes a bridge, not a barrier.

noble_confession_end.speaker: The Masked Noble
noble_confession_end.text: I need to think. About who I truly am, and who I could become. Thank you... for seeing me. The real me. Not the crown, not the title. Just... me.
